tool.name: Fusion Annotation Tool
tool.description: Create annotation files for fusion annotation. Run Oncotator and get sequence context.

param.name: json_sample_metrics
param.label: Sample metrics output in JSON format.

param.name: filter
param.label: Filter non-coding RNAs
param.help: Check to remove specific non coding RNAs and tRNA mitochondrial genes. Keeps all others such as protein-coding mitochondrial genes. Based on this regular expression: MT-T|MT-RNR|RNA18S5|RNA28S5|RNA5-85S

param.name: genomeSource
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in index?
param.help: Built-ins were indexed using default options

param.name: index
param.label: Select a reference genome
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact the Galaxy team

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

tool.help:
usage: fusion_annotation.py [-h] [-f] [--version] starfusion json_sample_metrics path_to_fasta
Annotate starfusion output with oncotator and nts sequences.
positional arguments: starfusion STAR-Fusion output star- fusion.fusion_candidates.final.abridged.FFPM json_sample_metrics Sample level metrics file path_to_fasta Full path to fasta.fa file, with index file
optional arguments: -h, --help show this help message and exit -f filter out specific ribosomal and mitochondrial fusions --version show program's version number and exit # Input Input should be the final, abridged, FFPM from STAR-Fusion. Should be called star-fusion.fusion_candidates.final.abridged.FFPM. Sample Metrics from sample_metrics.xml Galaxy tool.
# Output Bedpe formatted, 25 base pair sequences around breakpoint, optionally filtered
